
## Description

monitor vital signs of your server :

- CPU usage %
- RAM usage %


# nodejs-system-info

[![JavaScript Style Guide](https://img.shields.io/badge/code_style-standard-brightgreen.svg)](https://standardjs.com)
[![Build Status](https://api.travis-ci.org/SunilWang/node-os-utils.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/SunilWang/node-os-utils)
[![NPM Version][npm-image]][npm-url]
[![NPM Downloads][downloads-image]][downloads-url]


## Installation

One line installation with [npm](http://npmjs.org).

```bash
$ npm i nodejs-system-info --save
```
Then in your code

## Example

```js
var systemInformation = require('nodejs-system-info');

const INTERVAL = 500;

const systemMonitor = new systemInformation(INTERVAL);

systemMonitor.log(['cpu', 'ram']);

```


## Configuration

require('nodejs-system-info').options

Default settings:

- `cpu` display CPU usage percentage. 
- `ram` display RAM usage percentage. 
- `INTERVAL` is `500` millisecond. Represents the refresh of the cpu and ram usage.

:warning: If this module uses too much CPU, set the `INTERVAL` value to 10000 or more.

## Info

If you have `not supported` in some categories, your OS configuration is not supported for this option.

## Usage
The following methods are available:

### require('nodejs-system-info').get()

```js
var systemInformation = require('nodejs-system-info');

const INTERVAL = 500;

const systemMonitor = new systemInformation();

setInterval(() => {
  console.log(systemMonitor.get(['cpu']));
}, INTERVAL);
```
### require('nodejs-system-info').log()

CPU average

```js
var systemInformation = require('nodejs-system-info');

const INTERVAL = 500;

const systemMonitor = new systemInformation(INTERVAL);

systemMonitor.log(['cpu']);

```
```
Interval:  500
CPU_Usage: 20.65%
```

RAM average

```js
var systemInformation = require('nodejs-system-info');

const INTERVAL = 500;

const systemMonitor = new systemInformation(INTERVAL);

systemMonitor.log(['ram']);

```
```
Interval:  500
RAM_Usage: 77.91%
```



### Example monitor.js
```js
const SystemInformation = require('nodejs-system-info');
const commandLineArgs = require('command-line-args');

const DEFAULT_MONITOR_OPTIONS = ['cpu', 'ram'];

const optionDefinitions = [
  { name: 'interval', alias: 't', type: Number },
  { name: 'params', type: String, multiple: true, defaultOption: true }
];
const options = commandLineArgs(optionDefinitions);

const systemMonitor = new SystemInformation(options.interval);

systemMonitor.log(options.params || DEFAULT_MONITOR_OPTIONS);
```


Terminal Commands


```bash
node monitor.js (Default interval = 500ms, params = ram, cpu)

(Custom set interval ---interval  )
node monitor.js --interval 1000 

(Custom interval and params default ram and cpu )
node monitor.js --interval 500 --params ram cpu
```
